definition: to break into jail/to forcibly release prisoners
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]

sentences.english: But have you any reason for supposing a new rescue scheme is intended?
sentences.chinese: 但是你有什么理由怀疑他们将会劫狱呢？

sentences.english: The newspapers fed the public imagination with stories of uprisings and jail deliveries.
sentences.chinese: 报纸用叛乱和暴力劫狱的故事来满足公众的想象力。

sentences.english: Yes, the twitching , but also the damage done in the prison was too much.
sentences.chinese: 是的，在劫狱的时候也造成了大量损伤。

sentences.english: Gao Yishan get news team blade in jail-breaks TingSi bridge.
sentences.chinese: 高义山得到消息，刀锋队在汀泗桥劫狱的事情。

sentences.english: Police kill one escaped prisoner, capture three others.
sentences.chinese: 内蒙劫狱事件，一名逃犯被击毙，另外三人被捕。

definition: to break a prisoner out of jail
to assassinate/(military) to fight with a bayonet/(baseball) to put out (a baserunner)
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to carry out a vendetta against sb
